etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Nashe (d. c1601), writer. Origin uncertain. Perhaps from ramp + -allion, perhaps showing alteration of rascallion by association with ramp. Perhaps compare later ramscallion, rapscallion, tatterdemalion

definitions: A ruffian, a villain; a rascal.

notes.text: Chiefly used of a boy or man.
